direction.raw_text: : INT. VITTI'S CELL - MIDDLE OF NIGHT The cellblock is quiet. A guard stops outside the darkened cell, looks around to make sure no one is watching, then 4. pulls out a GUN with a SILENCER, reaches through the bars and FIRES REPEATEDLY into Vitti's shadowy form under the blanket. Then he slips away as quietly as he appeared. ON his exit we PAN DOWN TO Vitti, unhurt, curled up under his bunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now I'd like to call on Isaac's son, Dr. Ben Sobel, who would like to say a few words. Ben rises and crosses solemnly to the podium.

direction.raw_text: Not crazy. At least not permanently. In certain people, continuous exposure to an extremely stressful situation -- soldiers in combat, for instance, disaster victims, a hostage situation, or being locked up in a maximum security prison with someone trying to kill you -- it can produce a temporary psychotic state.

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying you've got to keep an open mind and explore some new possibilities. Try some different things -- maybe you'll connect with one of them. There's a career counselor I work with. I can call him for you. He may be able to help you find a job.

direction.raw_text: You mean working for somebody? I'm supposed to take orders from some guy who used to get me coffee? (starts sweating and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . breathing hard) I can't do that. It's not right. It's not me.

direction.raw_text: How do you know unless you try? Suddenly one of the WINDOWS behind Vitti SHATTERS. Ben dives for cover. Silence -- then another RAP on the window. Ben looks out and sees JELLY in the back yard, tossing stones at the window.

direction.raw_text: (calls out) Hiya, Doc. Sorry about the window. Ben waves him around to the side door.

direction.raw_text: I love  lox and bagels. I dated a Jewish  woman once. Actually, she might  have been the love of my life, but my  mother broke it up.

direction.raw_text: Really. (noting mountain of food on his plate) More smoked salmon? Don't be shy. Ben enters.

direction.raw_text: Jelly -- what are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makin' new friends. How's it going, Doc? I brought some clothes for Mr. Vitti.

direction.raw_text: Ben?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rising) You got it. (to Laura) Thanks, Mrs. S. (to others) So long, everybody.    Ess gesunterhait. Jelly and Ben exit.

direction.raw_text: So. Long time no see.     You look good, Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to be pleasant) And you, Jelly -- you look -- (can't find words for how he looks) Did you get a haircut? I thought you were in prison.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New trial. The evidence in my first trail was, you know, tainted. Turns out two of the witnesses against me changed their minds -- and the third one, he died after a short illness.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gunshot wound to the head.

direction.raw_text: I got stuff to do.

direction.raw_text: . INT. KNIGHTS OF PALERMO SOCIAL CLUB - DAY Soldiers lounge at the bar, keeping a respectful distance from the capos seated at a table in the rear. direction.raw_text: We're in a war, Paul -- nobody's safe right now. The Rigazzis are walkin' all over us. We got next to nothing coming in, and I don't have to tell you, you don't buy a lot of muscle without money these days. We need you, Paul. The family needs you.

direction.raw_text: So you'll think about it.    For me, Paulie?

direction.raw_text: Yeah, okay, I'll think about it.

direction.raw_text: (brightening) Hey, what is this -- a fuckin' funeral here? You just got back from college for Chrissakes. We should be havin' a party for you. (to bartender) Hey, Nino, give everybody a round here. We gotta drink to Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't, Sal.    I gotta go talk to the boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand. No problem. It's good to have you back, Paul. (embraces him) Don't forget what I said. We're countin' on you. Vitti gives his old friend a pat on the back and exits.

direction.raw_text: 'Yeah, what?'    That's how you answer the door?

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Vitti punches Eddie in the mouth, sending him sprawling back into the living room. Several other bodyguards are watching television, caught off guard by Vitti's sudden entrance.

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls out) In the kitchen, Paul.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to hear about Carmine.     He was a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You live with a person twenty- one years, then one day they're
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . pulling his torso out of the river. It's hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bet -- especially with all the talk about you being the one who put him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I try not to gossip, Paul. It's ugly. Just a sec. (screaming to ceiling) Michelle! Teresa! It's ten-thirty! Stop fucking around and get ready for ballet! (to Vitti) It's hard being a single parent and a career woman.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm sure you're very busy.

direction.raw_text: The pressure -- it's awful. For instance, a lot of people think, now that you're out, you're going to try and take the family back from me. But I said, no, Paul would never do that. (smiling) By the way, how are Marie and the kids? Still in Ohio? In Shaker Heights? At 1356 Locust? Vitti explodes, reaches across the counter and grabs her by the shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (enraged) You even go near them, you crazy bitch
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Don't make me call my guys in. You may need the shit kicked out of you, but not in here. I just mopped. Vitti lets her go.

direction.raw_text: (smoothing clothes, flushed and a little excited) Wow.   Have you been working out?

direction.raw_text: (hurt) Oh, Paul. You actually think I would kill you? All the years we've known each other -- the Christmas parties, the fun times at the beach. It wouldn't be right. I want us to be friends. (smiles demurely) Who knows? Maybe we'll be more than friends. Want to lick my beaters? She holds the beaters out to him.

direction.raw_text: (declining) Thanks. I gotta see a guy about a business thing.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, this is a legitimate business.

direction.raw_text: (shudders) Oh, Paul. I just got a chill.

direction.raw_text: I just want to be left alone.   Put my life back together -- straight  up this time. Put the word out, will   ya? Nobody's got nothin' to worry  about from me.

direction.raw_text: Sure, Paul.    I understand. He heads for the door.

direction.raw_text: (turning to Eddie) Watch him like a hawk. If he steps out of line, it would break my heart, but shoot him in the fuckin' head.

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Paul.    Appreciate it. Vitti moves to leave.

direction.raw_text: I'll get your drinks now.

His customers, a thirty-ish    YOUNG MAN and his FIANCEE, study the diamond engagement    ring on her finger.

direction.raw_text: What?

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?

direction.raw_text: (distraught) I can't deal with this shit. My grades suck, I'm gettin' in fights every day, and if I get suspended again my mother's gonna fuckin' kill me -- if the nuns don't kill me first. BEN is listening to Vitti, but dressed as Sigmund Freud.

direction.raw_text: (snorts some cocaine) Acht gemacht gehunden nicht.

direction.raw_text: I tell him the same thing. Suddenly, the WINDOWS are SHATTERED by GUNFIRE. DOOR BLASTS open, flying off the hinges. Jelly enters, pushed into the room by a gang of thugs, led by Patty LoPresti, Eddie DeVol and his guys, all at least ten-feet-tall and all holding huge guns. VITTI leaps to his feet and reaches for his gun, but instead pulls out a long sword. Confused but desperate, he holds up the sword to menace the intruders, but the sword suddenly goes limp. He tries to make the blade stand up, but it just keeps dropping like a piece of soft rope. Patty, Eddie, and the thugs laugh contemptuously at Vitti, while Jelly looks on with an incredible stream of tears pouring from his eyes. END DREAM SEQUENCE.

direction.raw_text: Now in here, I thought we'd get rid of the wallpaper and maybe put in some wainscoting -- She sees Vitti and quickly steers the decorator back outside.

direction.raw_text: Really? Do me a favor, honey -- make me a sandwich.

direction.raw_text: (tries new tack) Okay. You don't like me and I don't like you. We can at least agree on that, right?

direction.raw_text: We have so much in common. Anyway, this is not helping me, it's not helping my marriage, and I know Ben really needs some alone time. So I'm asking you -- as a human being -- could you please leave? (off Vitti's look) Yes, I'll make you a sandwich.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where am I going? The orphanage found my real parents. They want me back. (to Jelly) Put those in the car. (to Ben) I'm goin' to Jelly's. Jelly carries the luggage to his car parked in the driveway.

direction.raw_text: The hell you are. You're supposed to be in my custody. We have therapy today.

direction.raw_text: (winces) I don't want to know that.

direction.raw_text: You coulda hung wet towels on it.

direction.raw_text: (calls out) He's like a racehorse in that area.

direction.raw_text: Okay!   I get it.

direction.raw_text: Doc -- nothing's gonna fit. That nine-to-five bullshit -- I'll fuckin' kill myself if I have to do that for the rest of my life. You know they take taxes out of your check? What the fuck is that? I'm doomed. I'm gonna end up selling hot dogs on the street. (starts breathing hard and sweating) Look at me. I'm havin' a fuckin' panic attack here. My heart's beatin' like a rabbit.

direction.raw_text: You're hyperventilating.

direction.raw_text: . He empties the drugstore bag and hands it to Vitti.

direction.raw_text: Breathe into this. Vitti sits on a wicker chair.

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?

direction.raw_text: (jumps up, in a total rage) Hey, I'm doing the best I can!     If you can't appreciate that, or if my    best isn't good enough for you, then    maybe you should find somebody else to    talk to, you selfish prick! Ben breaks down and cries what amounts to one racking sob, then quickly pulls himself together.

direction.raw_text: Sorry.

direction.raw_text: What the hell was that?

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.    I'm grieving.   It's a process. Ben takes a pill bottle out of his pocket and pops a couple of pills.

direction.raw_text: Meet him and find out.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not social. Paul's meeting a television producer who might have a job for him. He's nervous and wants me here as a buffer. I'm a buffer, that's all.

direction.raw_text: He's a grown man. I don't see why he needs a chaperone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't. He needs a buffer.    I'm here in buffer capacity only.

direction.raw_text: Ben, if you say 'buffer' one more time
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? He can make every guy in this room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm not into that, fellas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your fuckin' hands off him!   He's with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, on the job? Vitti hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (impatiently) Either he's in, or he's dead.    Which is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think in is better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reluctantly) He's in. He's my responsibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Vitti) Okay, no more surprises. And from this moment on, no one leaves my sight. Got it? Now go through it one more time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- everybody listen up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! (sits) Okay.    Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder what it costs to keep that many limos waiting for three-and-a- half hours. THEIR POV A dozen men looking like Vitti and his crew come out of the club and get into the limos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody stand by. They're leaving. The limos drive off. At the corner, the FBI car pulls out and follows at a discreet distance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. RIVERBANK - LATER Police divers search for the sunken Mercedes in the middle of the channel. On shore, Ben leans against a government car looking tired and distraught while Chapin berates him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. VITTI'S TRAILER - DAY Vitti is hurriedly collecting his stuff, talking to Jelly and a few of his old gang.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. MAKEUP TRAILER - LATER Vitti makes his way past the trailers, heading for his car. As he passes the makeup trailer, the door opens and Tony Bella sticks his head out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MAKEUP TRAILER - MOMENTS LATER Vitti watches impatiently while the makeup artist touches up Tony Bella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. MAKEUP TRAILER - MOMENT LATER The door flies open and Tony Bella comes flying out of the trailer backwards, hitting the pavement hard. Vitti charges out of the trailer and storms away. Tony wipes blood from under his nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. SOBEL HOUSE - LATER A cab pulls up to the house, and Ben gets out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (minimizing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relents)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LITTLE DARLING'S - LATER THAT NIGHT Several limos are parked outside a family-owned nightclub in Queens. Ben pulls up, leaning way back in the driver's seat of Michael's, half-painted, modified '82 Honda Civic with the BUBBLING MUFFLERS.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CIVIC - CONTINUOUS ACTION Ben takes out a bottle of pills. He tries to remove the child-safety cap but his hands are shaking so badly he can't do it. Frustrated, he tries to bite the cap off, then gives up and throws the bottle away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LITTLE DARLING'S - SAME TIME Ben enters the club. A moment later, Cerrone and Miller cruise by in an unmarked car and park at the end of the block.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CLUB ENTRANCE - MOMENT LATER Ben enters the nightclub and starts moving through the crowd, looking for Vitti. He pushes through and sees Jelly and a few of the guys watching an exotic dancer, a beautiful young blonde in a skimpy costume, standing on a platform grinding in mock ecstasy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BASEMENT ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Vitti is seated at a big table in the crowded, smoke-filled room. Jelly sits at  his side. He's surrounded by his crew, about a half-a-dozen guys, and Patty's man, Eddie DeVol. Several street maps and diagrams are spread out on the table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LITTLE DARLING'S - SAME TIME Ben enters the back room of the club, looks around, and starts down the stairwell leading to the basement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BASEMENT STAIRWAY - MOMENTS LATER Ben makes his way down the cramped, dimly-lit stairway and approaches the door to the basement room. He raises his hand to knock, then hesitates and stands there for a moment listening to the MUFFLED VOICES inside. Suddenly he is grabbed from behind and slammed up against the door by Enormous Bobby. Bobby slams him against the door a couple of more times, using Ben's head as a doorknocker. The door is opened by someone inside and Enormous Bobby shoves Ben into the room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BASEMENT ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION Ben hits the floor to a chorus of surprised reactions from the guys. Enormous Bobby pulls Ben off the floor by his lapels.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LITTLE DARLING'S - LATER THAT NIGHT Agents Cerrone and Miller watch the front of the club from their car parked across the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yawns, checks watch)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. QUEENSBOROUGH BRIDGE - NIGHT The FBI car follows the limos across the bridge into Manhattan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. TIMES SQUARE - LATER The limos pull up at the WWF Restaurant.     The FBI car stops up the block.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (over radio)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: all units. W.W.F. Restaurant. Times Square. The limo doors open and the passengers get out -- all nondescript nobodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Vitti?   I don't see Vitti. Cerrone stares with the growing awareness that they've been had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (grimly, into radio) Call it off. We lost them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. See if this'll fit under your shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (extremely nervous) I could fit you under my shirt.    Don't they have anything smaller?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't Bloomingdale's. Nobody knew you were comin'. You're lucky you're alive, Doc. He glances at Eddie DeVol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hisses) Nobody's going to be alive when this is over. What kind of plan is this? It's crazy. It's stupid!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch it. It may be crazy but it ain't stupid. If you want to stay alive, just keep your mouth shut, do everything I tell you and try not to pee in your pants. (quietly) Can you handle an M-16? He holds up an automatic rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean shoot it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I mean twirl it like a fuckin' baton. How about an A.K.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He holds up another rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jelly -- JELLY (rummaging through pile) Kalashnikov, MAC-10, Uzi -- stop me if I hit one you like. Ben sees Eddie watching him and gingerly picks up a 9mm handgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't I just take this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's a good one. That gun brings back a lot of fond memories. Use it in good health. Ben puts the gun into the waistband of his dungarees, but it slips through and drops into his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (winces) Ooh, cold -- cold. He jams his hand down the front of his pants and starts searching around in there. Eddie and Enormous Bobby stare at him as they walk by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (explaining) My gun -- fell down in my -- He shakes his leg and the gun drops out of his cuff and clatters onto the floor. He smiles weakly and picks it up. Vitti approaches.    He looks agitated but under tight control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Jelly) Check the bus. Jelly exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly, to   Ben) If we can, I'm gonna   get you out before the real shit   goes down. Just don't flip out on me,   okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are making a huge mistake.   You know that, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said it yourself.   It's my nature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your nature!   You have a choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, fucking Jiminy Cricket? I don't know what planet you live on, but here on Earth it's 'might makes right.'   Read the papers. The guys with the guns make the rules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I guess that makes me a real man now.  What happened to the white hat, Paul?  Your father wasn't wrong. You could be one of the good guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough. Say one more word about my father and I'll break your fuckin' head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Vitti walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. BATHROOM - SAME TIME Vitti comes in, locks the door and has a full-blown panic attack -- gasping for breath, sweating, whimpering, trying to stifle his panic. Then he sees his tortured face in the mirror and starts pulling himself together. CUT TO: INT. WAREHOUSE - FEW MINUTES LATER The guys are getting into the trucks. Ben keeps letting everybody go in front of him, then starts to back away, but Eddie and Enormous Bobby come up behind him and push him up into the truck. EXT. MANHATTAN WAREHOUSE - NIGHT 106. The big doors open and two trucks roll out carrying Vitti, Ben and the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checks his watch) I have five to three. They should start movin' any minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at his watch) I have three-o-six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see your watch. Ben slips it off and hands it to him. Vitti smashes it on a rock with the butt of his gun, then tosses it back to Ben. Vitti's RADIO SQUAWKS and the spotter's voice is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (filtered) They're moving! Vitti keys his radio twice as a signal and holds up his clenched fist to alert the guys on site with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on walkie) Go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CONSTRUCTION SITE A bank of arc lights is switched on illuminating the site as the truck is lowered to the ground. Heavily-armed gangsters in ski masks surround the truck and herd the driver, the shotgun guard and the frightened marshals into a construction shack, while men with acetylene torches attack the back doors. Vitti pulls down his ski mask and taps Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, it's not too late.   Don't do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. He strides off to take charge. Ben pulls down his mask and hurries after him, but runs right into a pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!   Ow! He raises his mask and scampers after Vitti rubbing the painful bump on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts) Get the ramp! Eddie and his guys run up with a long, narrow track with metal rollers and set it up at the rear of the gold truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very excited) You know, this might just fuckin' work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna get in so much trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't get over the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then knock down the gates!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pops his head in) Forty bars. That's all we need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $350 an ounce, 16 ounces in a pound,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. FBI CAR - SAME TIME Miller watches intently.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MANHATTAN WAREHOUSE - MIDDLE OF NIGHT Vitti's guys are dressed like construction workers as they load their gear into two trucks. Vitti supervises while others work on a New York City bus. Eddie DeVol, Al Pacino and Enormous Bobby stand guard over the whole scene, in case anyone is thinking of defecting. Ben is wearing heavy dungarees and an oversized plaid shirt, struggling to lace his work boots. Jelly approaches him and tosses a bulletproof vest on the table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exasperated)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding up the pistol)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LEAD TRUCK - SAME TIME The guys are sitting on the floor in the back of the truck, lined up along the sides like paratroopers waiting to jump. Ben is sitting next to Jelly and across from Vitti who is just staring intently.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. WEST SIDE HIGHWAY - NIGHT The trucks make their way past the aircraft carrier Intrepid heading downtown.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CONSTRUCTION SITE - NIGHT (LATER) Vitti, Ben, and Eddie DeVol stand next to the treads of a giant crane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FEDERAL BUILDING - NIGHT A CONVOY of vehicles emerges from the bowels of the building and turns onto the street. In front and back are specially- equipped SUVs, full of heavily-armed federal marshals; an armored truck in the middle carries the gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. ANOTHER STREET - SAME TIME The convoy RUMBLES past a block-long, high-rise construction site, totally enclosed by a plywood wall around the perimeter. VITTI He can hear the convoy passing outside the wall. SPOTTER He looks down on the convoy from a vantage point on a scaffold high above the street. When the trucks are in the right position, he waves to Vitti on the ground. VITTI sees the signal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - CONTINUOUS ACTION A forty-foot, flat-bed trailer truck loaded with cement conduit backs across the street and stops, blocking the path of the convoy. The lead SUV HONKS. The truck doesn't move. The CAPTAIN of the marshals gets out and walks up to the truck. The driver has slipped out the other side and disappeared. Suddenly, a huge steel claw drops down from above and closes around the top of the armored truck, its sharp points crunching into the metal sides. Then the truck starts rising off the pavement. A couple of determined marshals jump out of their vehicles, race over and grab onto the bumpers as the armored truck is lifted off the ground.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CONSTRUCTION SITE - CONTINUOUS ACTION A hundred-foot tower crane lifts the truck straight up. The marshals hang on as long as they can, then prudently let go and drop heavily to the street. Two marshals are still clinging to the truck as it rises to a height of thirty feet, then swings silently over the perimeter fencing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - SAME TIME The marshals run around, frantically searching for a way into the construction site.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : VITTI Totally in charge, he strides up to the armored truck just as his men finish cutting through the steel plate doors. Vitti yanks the doors open.. Vitti and Ben stare in awe at the exposed contents of the truck -- a fortune in gold bars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - SAME TIME The marshals are trying to climb over the construction site wall, but they're stopped by rolls of razor wire and SUPPRESSING FIRE from inside the site.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CONSTRUCTION SITE The guys take the heavy bars out of the armored truck and run them quickly along the rolling track into the bus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BUS - SAME TIME Jelly is pulling on the hat and jacket of a transit authority bus driver. The floor boards of the bus have been lifted out and the guys are laying the gold bars in the hollow under the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pounds in each bar -- do the math.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a beat) Actually, gold is measured in troy ounces. 14.6 ounces to the pound. That would be... $18,396,000.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give or take. He hears a LOUD CRASH and all eyes turn to the gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, so much for not peeing in my pants. Eddie goes off to help transfer the gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - SAME TIME The marshals back up one of the SUVs and run it into the gates again. CUT TO: INT. CONSTRUCTION SITE The big, wooden GATES SHUDDER but Vitti's men roll two enormous earthmovers up to reinforce the gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what you said about not flipping out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. (flipping out) What did I do? What did I do? I had a perfect life, I threw it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do this. Vitti drags him off toward the building structure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help it! My life is over! I'm going to jail. Some people can handle prison -- I'm not one of them. I have delicate features. I'm small. I'll be way too popular!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't calm down!      I'm gonna die! Inside the structure, Vitti spins him around and shakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not gonna die!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't breathe! I'm suffocating!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking him) For Chrissake, get hold of yourself!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't!   I'm dying!   We're all going to die! Suddenly, he slaps Vitti hard across the face.      They both freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I just hit you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   Feel better now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breaking down) I'm sorry, Paul. I blame myself for this. I wanted to help you. I wanted to be there for you. But I just wasn't good enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were good.  It isn't your fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it is. Since my father died -- (starts crying) I've lost my way. I don't know anything anymore. I mean, what's the point? I didn't think it would hit me so hard -- VITTI Would you just shut up about your father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm grieving, goddammit!    Have a little respect!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was an asshole -- you said it yourself. What are you grieving for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm grieving for myself, you fucking idiot! Ben lets it all go, sobbing for all the years of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised, shrugs) Jeez, I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know how you must have felt when your father was killed. Vitti looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying more) I mean, it had to be ten times worse for you -- being murdered right in front of you. And you were so young - -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have time for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (really sobbing) It must've been so painful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eyes filling with tears) I'm warning you -- don't do this -- BEN I mean, it's like all his hopes for you died with him. And that's so sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (starting to cry) There I go. You happy now?      You see what you're doing here? Both men are crying now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father really loved you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loved him, too. I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hugs him) I know. I know. Jelly comes around the corner and sees the two men in a weepy embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, boy.    This is bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Another huge CRASH as the marshals ram the gates again, this time tearing loose one of the big hinges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we oughta should go. Vitti, Ben and Jelly run to the bus, but Eddie pulls a gun and stops them. Al and Bobby cover Jelly and the rest of the crew. Vitti backs away slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you really think you were gonna live through this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had my hopes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, nice work.   Mr. Rigazzi will be very grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Vitti) Rigazzi? I thought he worked for Patti LoPresti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what Patty thought, too. This scumbag's been playin' both sides against the middle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only one side as far as I'm concerned. Mine. What did you think? I was just gonna stand by and let some fuckin' has-been move back in? So long, Mr. Vitti. He cocks the gun and is about to pull the trigger when Ben suddenly roars and slams him in the head with his gun. Vitti and Jelly quickly cover Al Pacino and Enormous Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beating the shit out of Eddie) I can't take it anymore! That's what I hate about you fucking sociopaths! You just keep changing the rules to suit yourselves. Well, not this time, you anti-social asshole. You fucked with the wrong shrink! Sitting on Eddie's chest, he presses the gun against Eddie's nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you read the papers?   The guy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . with the gun makes the rules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, what? They shove Eddie, Enormous Bobby and Al Pacino into the back of the armored truck, Vitti gives a signal and the crane lifts it off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - CONTINUOUS ACTION The armored truck comes down fast and drops heavily to the street. Federal MARSHALS swarm the truck and find Eddie, Al, and Bobby sprawled in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the floor! Face-down!   Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice goin'. Good plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's a sociopath? The marshals handcuff them. Suddenly, the marshals hear AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE coming from the next block. Uniformed SWAT COPS come running from that direction and shout to the marshals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're escaping out the back!    Get over there! Move it! The marshals rush toward the sound of the GUNFIRE and disappear around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freeze! Drop your weapons!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The head wiseguy, Anthony Bella, turns in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on his own bullhorn) Cut, cut, cut! What the hell's going on? Raoul strides out into the street, furious, still talking through his bullhorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the Captain) Who are you? What are you doing in my shot? The Captain and the marshals look around and see that they're on the set of "Little Caesar."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing on my street? The Captain walks toward Raoul until they are almost face to face, shouting at each other through their BULLHORNS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a permit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a shit about your permit! The ASSISTANT DIRECTOR addresses the TV crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, people. Back to one and let's try it again! (into his walkie-talkie) Release the traffic and reset for another take. On the perimeters of the set, the PA's signal the off-duty cops who work the set to release the real traffic they've been holding on the cross streets. A city bus passes behind Raoul and Tony Bella who are still screaming at the Federal Marshal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sees them coming) That's it. We're screwed. The cops walk toward the back and confront Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Officer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're one tough shrink. The cops unmask. It's Mo-Mo, Cokes, and Tuna.     They laugh and slap hands with Vitti and Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feeling pretty good, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what now? You go on the run for the rest of your life? Back to Sing Sing? Or you turn up dead in an alley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are my choices? What   happened to lying on a beach in Costa  Rica for the next twenty years?   You can't let me enjoy this for  five fuckin' minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five minutes?    And then what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then what?    I'll show you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acting on intelligence we developed in the last few days, the Justice Department and the F.B.I. took very aggressive action to recover the stolen gold and bring the perpetrators to justice. I'm happy to tell the people of New York that the streets are safe again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Paul.   How'd it go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I heard. It's all over the television. I never should've trusted Eddie. But, you know, a woman alone in the world is very vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least I don't have to worry about the Rigazzis no more. Thanks to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you -- I just want to be left
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'll make sure. How about some breakfast? I could make you some waffles and -- whatever else you want. She adjusts her robe, providing Vitti a quick peek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't do that. Patty smiles and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if you ever change your mind -- (kisses him) Good luck, Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see Patti?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ruefully) Did she grab your balls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of question is that? She's cool. She's just happy to have 'the Wrench' out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I talked to the U.S. Attorney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he grab your balls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Paul, he did not grab my balls. He thanked me for tipping him off about the gold. And he said he won't be coming after you if you stay out of trouble.  So what do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna go to Ohio -- get Marie and the kids -- then we'll probably disappear for awhile -- figure out all
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . this future stuff
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : NEXT BLOCK As the marshals round the corner, they see a police shoot-out in progress. Wiseguys are FIRING AUTOMATIC WEAPONS at cops who are pinned down behind police cruisers. The Captain of the marshals FIRES a warning SHOT in the air.

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. 11TH AVENUE - MINUTES LATER In mid-block, SWAT cops step into the street and wave the bus to a halt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BUS - SAME TIME Ben is sitting in the back with Vitti as the helmeted SWAT cops board the bus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - CONTINUOUS ACTION The bus pulls out and joins the flow of traffic heading downtown.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BUS - MINUTES LATER All the guys are looking pretty happy with their score. Ben turns to Vitti.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. RIGAZZI PLUMBING AND HEATING - NEXT MORNING A Rigazzi company van is forced open by a team of FBI agents led by Agent Miller. Stacked inside are forty gold bars. Agent Cerrone comes out of the building with Lou Rigazzi and several associates in handcuffs. U.S. Attorney Chapin makes a statement to the media.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. PATTY'S HOUSE - SAME TIME Vitti knocks on the front door.    Patty answers it in her robe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. EAST RIVER BOARDWALK - LATER MORNING Ben is leaning against the railing gazing at the water when Vitti walks up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Good idea. Change is hard, Paul.    But you did the right thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you, too. You hung in there. That took a lot of guts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I just -- VITTI No, you were like an animal back there.

direction.raw_text: No. I'm telling you. You're a monster. I saw the beast in you.

direction.raw_text: I'm not a beast. I can handle myself if I have to -- VITTI Handle yourself? You were fuckin' John Wayne.

direction.raw_text: I'm not -- VITTI Paul, I just -- VITTI No. You are good. You got a gift, my friend. Ben gives up.

direction.raw_text: Fine.   I have a gift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So -- happy ending, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I think so.   Don't you feel better now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? I feel like shit. All that work for nothing. 20 million bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're grieving -- it's a process.

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, Doc.

direction.raw_text: You, too, Paul. They embrace. Then Vitti starts to walk away toward Jelly who has been waiting at a respectful distance. Vitti stops and turns.
